text: Psalm 144
A Prayer for National Safety
Of David.\f + \fr Ps 144 \ft The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm \f*
Blessed be Yahweh, my rock,
the one who trains my hands for battle,
my fingers for war—
my loyal love and my fortress,
my stronghold and my deliverer,
my shield, and \add one\add* in whom I take refuge,
the one who subdues peoples\f + \fr 144:2 \ft Reading with many Hebrew manuscripts and versions; MT reads “my people” \f* under me.
O Yahweh, what \add is\add* humankind that you take knowledge of him,
\add or the\add* son of man that you take thought of him?
Humankind is like a breath,
his days like a passing shadow.
O Yahweh, bow the heavens and come down;
touch the mountains so that they smoke.
Flash forth lightning and scatter them;
dispatch your arrows and rout them.
Stretch out your hands from on high;
Rescue me and deliver me from many waters,
from \add the\add* hand of foreigners,
whose mouth speaks falsely,
and their right hand \add is\add* a false right hand.
O God, I will sing a new song to you.
With a lyre of ten \add strings\add* I will sing praise to you,
who gives victory to kings,
who rescues David his servant
from \add the\add* evil sword.
Rescue me and deliver me
from \add the\add* hand of foreigners,
whose mouth speaks falsely,
and whose right hand \add is\add* a false right hand,
that our sons \add may be\add* like plants,
full grown in their youth,
our daughters like corner pillars,
carved in the style of a palace,
\add that\add* our granaries \add may be\add* full,
providing \add produce\add* of all kinds,\f + \fr 144:13 \ft Hebrew “from kind to kind” \f*
\add that\add* our sheep \add may\add* produce by the thousands,
by the tens of thousands in our open fields,
\add that\add* our cattle \add may be\add* pregnant;
\add that there be\add* no breach \add in our walls\add*,
and no going out \add in exile\add*,
and no outcry in our plazas.
Blessed \add are\add* the people who have \add it\add* thus.
Blessed \add are\add* the people whose God \add is\add* Yahweh.
